Name: Shabti case
Description: This shabti case of wood was part of the collection of É. de Meester de Ravestein. Dating from the Late Period, the object depicts on each of its four sides a genie with the head of a jackal and a human body. In their hands, they hold the bandages for wrapping the dead. On the lid, one distinguishes an inscription, probably containing the name of the owner, flanked on each side by a jackal who is reclining on a naos.
